sub_topic: Identifying the planarity of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph: 

```
        A
       / \
      B---C
     / \ / \
    D---E---F
```
Is the above graph planar? Justify your answer.
message_2:
Yes, the above graph is planar. A graph is planar if it can be drawn in a plane without any edges crossing each other. The given graph can be drawn without any edge crossings as shown below:

```
        A
       / \
      B---C
     /     \
    D-------F
     \     /
      E---/
```

In this representation, no edges cross each other, so the graph is planar.
